metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4429 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the clntudp_call function insunrpc/clnt_udp.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) allows remoteservers to cause a denial of service (crash) or possibly unspecified otherimpact via a flood of crafted ICMP and UDP packets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-armel - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-pic - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.24-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.24-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.24-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.24-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libtirpc-common - 0.2.5-1.1
libtirpc3 - 0.2.5-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.24-0ubuntu1').
libtirpc package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.5-1.1').
